meanings.definition: A salad made of finely shredded raw cabbage and sometimes shredded carrots, mixed with mayonnaise or a vinaigrette dressing.
meanings.sent1: I love to have coleslaw with my sandwich for lunch.
meanings.sent2: At the picnic, everyone enjoyed the coleslaw with the burgers.
meanings.sent3: The coleslaw decided to have a dance party with the other salads.
meanings.sent4: The coleslaw was a colorful confetti of vegetables in a bowl.
meanings.sent5: The coleslaw sparkled like a fresh garden on a plate.

meanings.definition: A side dish typically served with barbecue or fried chicken.
meanings.sent1: The coleslaw complemented the smoky flavor of the barbecue ribs.
meanings.sent2: When we ordered fried chicken, the coleslaw came as a side dish.
meanings.sent3: The coleslaw told a joke to the barbecue sauce, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The coleslaw was a cool breeze next to the hot fried chicken.
meanings.sent5: The coleslaw was like a refreshing oasis on the plate of fried chicken.
